label: CT200
description: Vivint Element Thermostat w/ other sensors
info_overview: This thermostat is provided by Vivint, but can join a non-Vivint ZWave network.
info_inclusion:
The Vivint Element Thermostat is a Z-Wave® compliant thermostat. It has an onboard radio that can be added to an existing Z-Wave® network. This device can be used on a network with products from different vendors.

  1. Set your primary controller to INCLUDE mode to add the thermostat as a node on your network (see your specific controller’s User Manual for detailed instructions).
  2. The Thermostat main screen shows a welcome message. Press the SIDE button to continue.
  3. Press the SIDE button to initiate the inclusion process. This initiates the network connection process.
    • If inclusion fails, the screen says “Failed”. Press the SIDE button to try adding again.
  4. When the Thermostat has been successfully included to a Z-Wave network, the screen displays a confirmation check mark. Press the SIDE button to continue. You can now configure the thermostat to work with your HVAC system.
  5. Your primary controller indicates that the thermostat was successfully added to its network (see your specific controller’s User Manual for details).
info_exclusion: The Vivint Element can be excluded from the Z-Wave network process similar to the inclusion process. Set your primary controller to EXCLUDE.
info_wakeup:
When your thermostat is running on battery power, the Z-Wave radio will turn off to help conserve battery life. The Thermostat Z-Wave radio module supports Z-Wave beaming, which allows other devices in the network to wake up the Z-Wave module and accept commands and then go back to sleep.

When your thermostat is running on C-Wire power, the Z-Wave radio will stay on and actively help route messages within the Z-Wave network. The thermostat’s node type is fixed when it is included to the Z-Wave network; if the C-Wire is present and powered when including to the network, the thermostat will remain an alwayslistening node until it is removed from the network.

parameters.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold (8-bit)
parameters.description: This value determines the reporting threshold
parameters.overview:
This value determines the reporting threshold when association reporting is enabled.

Unsupported values are ignored.

parameters.label: HVAC Settings
parameters.overview:
Byte 1 = HVAC Setup: Normal (0x01) or Heat Pump (0x02)

Byte 2 = Aux Setup (Gas (0x01) or Electric (0x02)) & Number of Auxiliary Stages (Heat Pump)/Number of Heat Stages (Normal)

Byte 3 = Number of Heat Pump Stages

Byte 4 = Number of Cool Stages

parameters.label: Utility Lock
parameters.description: Enable or Disable the Utility Lock
parameters.overview: If set to 0, the utility lock is disabled. All other values (1-255) enable the utility lock.

parameters.label: C-Wire/Battery Status
parameters.description: Query power which source is in use
parameters.overview:
If 0x01, the thermostat is powered by a C-wire.

If 0x02, the thermostat is powered by batteries.

parameters.label: Humidity Reporting Threshold
parameters.description: This value determines the reporting threshold
parameters.overview: This value determines the reporting threshold when association reporting is enabled. Unsupported values are ignored.

parameters.label: Auxiliary/Emergency
parameters.overview:
If set to 0, auxiliary / emergency heat is disabled.

All other values (1-255) enable auxiliary / emergency heat.

This can only be enabled when the thermostat is set to Heat Pump mode.

parameters.label: Thermostat Swing Temp
parameters.description: Temperature spread between the on and off temperatures
parameters.overview:
The thermostat swing temperature is in units of 0.5 degrees Fahrenheit.

A value of 0x01 is 0.5F and 0x02 is 1.0F.

The supported values may vary from thermostat to thermostat but typically the allowed values are 0.5F (0x01) to 4.0F (0x08).

parameters.label: Thermostat Diff Temp
parameters.description: How far off from target temp before turning on unit
parameters.overview:
The thermostat differential temperature is in units of 0.5 degrees

Fahrenheit. A value of 0x04 is 2.0F and 0x06 is 3.0F. The differential

temperature must be an integer value. Non-integer values, such

as 1.5F (0x03), should not be used. The supported values may vary

from thermostat to thermostat but typically, the allowed values are

2.0F (0x04) to 6.0F (0x0C).

parameters.label: Thermostat Recovery Mode
parameters.description: Bring a space back to a normal occupied temp
parameters.overview:
The Thermostat Recovery Mode can be either fast (0x01) or

economy (0x02).

parameters.label: Simple UI Mode
parameters.overview:
If set to 0, Simple UI mode is disabled. If set to 1, Simple UI mode

is enabled.

parameters.label: Multicast
parameters.overview: If set to 0, Multicast is disabled. If set to 1, Multicast is enabled.

parameters.label: Main Display Selection
parameters.description: Control which info is displayed in the main display area
parameters.overview: This configuration Param on the CT110 sets what information is displayed in the main thermostat display area (the largest central numbers on the display). The default values is to display the Temperature (0x01) on the main numbers.

parameters.label: Save Energy Mode Type
parameters.overview: This configuration value is used to read/write what behavior Save Energy Mode causes in the thermostat when the thermostat enters Save Energy Mode.

parameters.label: Fan Timer
parameters.description: Activate Fan w/ auto shutoff timer
parameters.overview: This configuration is used to activate the fan with an automatic shut-off timer.

parameters.label: Temperature Calibration
parameters.overview: This configuration is used to set the temperature offset of the thermostat. The valid values are from -6 to 6. Note: although the thermostat UI can set calibrations in intervals of 0.5°F, this parameter can only accept whole numbers.

parameters.label: Display Units
parameters.overview: This configuration is used to set units used by the device to display temperature.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.

notices: Endpoint 0 has no command class linked to the basic class.
Endpoint 1 has no command class linked to the basic class.
